results.title: Le grand siecle de Louis XIV = The great reign of Louis XIV
results.brief_description:
Episode 18 of Series “Il Etait Une Fois L’homme” (= “Once Upon a Time Man”).
A lot of time in this episode is devoted to the transformation of a simple hunting lodge into a palace worthy of the magnificence of Louis XIV. In 1680 Versailles is finally inaugurated after more than 20 years of work which calls upon the best talents of the time: Levaux, Lebrun, Lenotre, Hardouin-Mansart etc… Apart from a foray into French classicism in architecture, this episode also treats of the French religious conflict, opposing catholics and protestants.

Credits: Director, writer, Albert Barille ; photography, Jean-Louis Karcher ; art direction, Philippe Landrot, Rene Borg ; graphic research, Jean Barbaud.
Cast: Roger Carel, Francine Laine, Pierre Trabaud, Henri Djanik [original French narration].

results.title: Le Cro-Magnon
results.brief_description:
Episode 3 of Series “Il Etait Une Fois L’homme” (= “Once Upon a Time Man”).
Following the Ice Age, the era of Cro Magnon starts. The tool making technique has made vast progress. Cro-Magnon is an expert at using stones, bones and skins. He also has a strong artistic bent as demonstrated by the production of human-shaped statuettes and rock face paintings. Cro-Magnon takes the leap from hunter to herder, helped in his endeavour by his ability to domesticate dogs.

Credits: Director, writer, Albert Barille ; photography, Jean-Louis Karcher ; art direction, Philippe Landrot, Rene Borg ; graphic research, Jean Barbaud.
Cast: Roger Carel, Francine Laine, Pierre Trabaud, Henri Djanik [original French narration].

results.title: La Revolution Francaise = the French Revolution
results.brief_description:
Episode 22 of Series “Il Etait Une Fois L’homme” (= “Once Upon a Time Man”).
A fourty minute overview of the events spanning from the storming of La Bastille to the irresistible ascent of Bonaparte. Reference: Encyclopedia Britannica.

Credits: Director, writer, Albert Barille ; photography, Jean-Louis Karcher ; art direction, Philippe Landrot, Rene Borg ; graphic research, Jean Barbaud.
Cast: Roger Carel, Francine Laine, Pierre Trabaud, Henri Djanik [original French narration].

results.title: La Belle Epoque
results.brief_description:
Episode 24 of Series “Il Etait Une Fois L’homme” (= “Once Upon a Time Man”).
What is commonly know as La Belle Epoque covers the years from 1870 to 1914. It is a time of great progress, both intellectual and technical. This episode focuses of the advances in the automotive industry and railways. Other topics include: the colinzation of the African continent, the construction of the Metro in Paris and the cinematograph. The October Revolution in Russia and the beginning of the mobilization in 1914 are also mentionned.

Credits: Director, writer, Albert Barille ; photography, Jean-Louis Karcher ; art direction, Philippe Landrot, Rene Borg ; graphic research, Jean Barbaud.
Cast: Roger Carel, Francine Laine, Pierre Trabaud, Henri Djanik [original French narration].

results.title: L'age des Vikings
results.brief_description:
Episode 10 of Series “Il Etait Une Fois L’homme” (= “Once Upon a Time Man”).
The Carolingian Empire has crumbled. In Southern Europe, the Sarazins have invaded Sicily, Rome and Provence. In the East, the Magyars make progress toward Lombardia, Venetia and Burgundy. The North is about to experience the full might of the Normans. This episode covers the organization of Viking society as well as their advances in boat building techniques and marine navigation instrumentation.

Credits: Director, writer, Albert Barille ; photography, Jean-Louis Karcher ; art direction, Philippe Landrot, Rene Borg ; graphic research, Jean Barbaud.
Cast: Roger Carel, Francine Laine, Pierre Trabaud, Henri Djanik [original French narration].

results.title: L'age d'or des Provinces Unies = The golden age of the United Provinces
results.brief_description:
Episode 17 of Series “Il Etait Une Fois L’homme” (= “Once Upon a Time Man”).
The Republic Of The United Netherlands, consisted of the seven northern Netherlands provinces that won independence from Spain from 1568 to 1609, and it grew out of the Union of Utrecht (1579). For the next two centuries political control of the decentralized state shifted repeatedly between the province of Holland and the princes of Orange, who held the office of stadholder and represented a greater degree of centralization. This internal political stress, however, did not prevent the ascendancy of the Dutch Republic in the 17th century. In this ‘Golden Age’ the Republic developed a worldwide colonial empire far out of proportion to its resources. It also played a notable role in the coalition wars against Louis XIV of France. As the Republic emerged as a centre of international finance, it alsom served as a notable cultural centre. This episode also covers the establishment of the East India Company in 1594, the settlement of the Puritans in New Amsterdam (New York) and the Black Tulip scandal. Reference: Encyclopedia Britannica.

Credits: Director, writer, Albert Barille ; photography, Jean-Louis Karcher ; art direction, Philippe Landrot, Rene Borg ; graphic research, Jean Barbaud.
Cast: Roger Carel, Francine Laine, Pierre Trabaud, Henri Djanik [original French narration].

results.title: Et la Terre Fut ...
results.brief_description:
Episode 1 of Series “Il Etait Une Fois L’homme” (= “Once Upon a Time Man”).
This first episode deals with the formation of the Earth and the apparition of life on Earth with the amphibians and other prehistorical animals. This episode also covers the evolution of primates, the domestication of fire and the development of hunting techniques.

Credits: Director, writer, Albert Barille ; photography, Jean-Louis Karcher ; art direction, Philippe Landrot, Rene Borg ; graphic research, Jean Barbaud.
Cast: Roger Carel, Francine Laine, Pierre Trabaud, Henri Djanik [original French narration].

results.title: European Art School: 2
results.creator_credit: Anders Holmertz and European Art School
results.brief_description: This program introduces more advanced drawing techniques moving to instruction in the representation of images in three dimensions. Simple shapes like the sphere, cone, cube and cylinder are used as practical examples for drawing and then methods of creating a mood and weathertype or a sense of perspective are explored through the use of particular patterns. The use of different art materials such as charcoal and ink and differing types of paintbrushes are also discussed with attention to their popularity and the quality of those available.

results.title: Eumig P8 Standard 8mm Silent Projector
results.brief_description: Eumig P8 Standard 8mm silent projector s.n. 1091069 with take up spool, Philips projector lamp type 7909. Does not have original box.

results.title: Eumig Wien Type P8 Electrical Projector in box
results.brief_description:
Boxed Projector Eumig Wien Type P8 electrical projector Housed in Vinyl bound box. Green felt covered board/lid for inside box. This board has a leather tab which helps to lift the board up. The top metal handle on the projector can be clicked in to stay up, or it can be pushed down. The feet at the front are adjustable and allow for a tilting adjustment. Lens: Coated Eupro F1.6 25mm lens The machine must be opened to erect the spool arms. Brown power cord with a Eumig logo. Australian power plug (Ring grip, 10 AMP, 250 V, Made in Australia) English instruction manual enclosed. Eumig metal spool housed in original cardboard box. Made in Austria.

Reel capacity: 120m / 400ft diameter: 175mm diameter x 13mm depth Kelvin clear plastic spool. Made in Australia.

Reel capacity: 120m / 400ft diameter: 177mm diameter x 14mm depth yellow piece of card ribbon inside.

2 identical Philips projection lamps in their original boxes with double sided instructions. The lamp inside the box is packaged between two pieces of corrugated cardboard. 7238N / 05 12V 100W B15S A8 Made in Germany

Broken brush made from real hair. Made in Japan. (used for cleaning?)
